column4: you ever noticed how suspicious ie7pro is? there's something really bad going on with that add-on, must be
I have no idea why, but the totem plugin is 20x more stable (never crashes browser no matter what) with Epiphany.. with firefox it just sucks, and you'd better off with mplayer-plugin perhaps
thats reboot the gui, i thought linux never had reboots
actually most of the config files are in same places due LSB, and you usually don't have to edit them anyways nowadays
LSB? and how to get READ graphics drivers to work without edit thet xorg file and reboot linux?
there's no xorg.config on newest versions at all, it's automatic. and you don't have to reboot, just ctrl-alt-backspace is enough :)
mu? are you a cow now?
you know, linux isn't really better. it is just a tool, and your needs dictate what is better and what you should use.
if you feel that Windows is better, then stick with it :)
but the site http://www.whylinuxisbetter.net/ said linux is so much better then windows

there are a lot of zealots and fanboys making those pages. but seriously, what you have now is general change resistance. you are against linux providing equivalent things DIFFERENTLY. it is not even always meant to be alike actually.
oki, but i saw one page they wrote firefox protects your from virus and stuff like that, is firefox a browser AND antivirus ?
no, firefox is plain honestly complete trash if you take a closer look at the quality of that application.

you really might be surprised to try out for instance konqueror and then having one of those cases where your multimedia plugin goes haywire. nothing special will happen. no crash. and it renders the page at least equally well and is meaner and leaner. :) (no, I don't use konqueror myself - that was just an example)
